N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9730.3 - Prehearing responsibilities

State Regulations

When the contractor is notified that a request for a fair
hearing has been received, it shall: (a) send the appellant or his/her
representative copies of all documents to be submitted into evidence at the
hearing in support of the contractor's action; (b) provide copies of any document or
information in the file if requested by appellant or his/her representative, without charge; (c) take such
action as is necessary to assure that an appropriate representative will appear
at the hearing with the case file and a brief written summary including: (1)
the names, addresses, relationships and
ages of persons affected; (2)
the
decision or action which prompted the request for the fair hearing; (3)
a brief description of the facts, evidence and reasons allegedly supporting such decision or action, including
identification of the specific provisions of law or regulations which allegedly
support the action; (4)
the income
determination prepared for the appellant; and
(5)
a copy of its determination upon
reconsideration. Notes
